text: 715316825 | DSCH | 39368889 | | 6121802 | 3/30/2006 12:00:00 AM | congestive heart failure | | DIS | Admission Date: 3/30/2006 Report Status: Discharge Date: 6/10/2006 ****** FINAL DISCHARGE ORDERS ****** EVANGELO , DEANGELO J. 589-43-94-6 Win Ter Call Service: CAR DISCHARGE PATIENT ON: 6/2/06 AT 01:00 PM CONTINGENT UPON Attending evaluation WILL D/C ORDER BE USED AS THE D/C SUMMARY: YES Attending: DURTSCHE , JERAMY E. , M.D. CODE STATUS: Full code DISPOSITION: Rehabilitation DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS: TYLENOL ( ACETAMINOPHEN ) 650 MG PO Q4H PRN Headache ACETYLSALICYLIC ACID 81 MG PO DAILY ALBUTEROL NEBULIZER 2.5 MG NEB Q4H PRN Shortness of Breath , Wheezing ALLOPURINOL 100 MG PO DAILY NORVASC ( AMLODIPINE ) 5 MG PO DAILY Food/Drug Interaction Instruction Avoid grapefruit unless MD instructs otherwise. VITAMIN C ( ASCORBIC ACID ) 500 MG PO BID LIPITOR ( ATORVASTATIN ) 80 MG PO BEDTIME Starting Today ( 5/19 ) CALTRATE + D 1 TAB PO BID COLCHICINE 0.6 MG PO DAILY COLACE ( DOCUSATE SODIUM ) 100 MG PO BID ENOXAPARIN 100 MG SC DAILY ERGOCALCIFEROL 50 , 000 UNITS PO QWEEK Instructions: Tuesday; Continue until 5/14 FERROUS SULFATE 325 MG PO DAILY Food/Drug Interaction Instruction Avoid milk and antacid FLONASE NASAL SPRAY ( FLUTICASONE NASAL SPRAY ) 2 SPRAY NA DAILY FLOVENT HFA ( FLUTICASONE PROPIONATE ) 220 MCG INH BID LASIX ( FUROSEMIDE ) 120 MG IV BID X 4 doses Starting Today ( 5/19 ) Instructions: Give lasix 120mg BID x2 days total , then reduce to 120mg QAM + 80mg QPM. LASIX ( FUROSEMIDE ) 120 MG QAM; 80 MG QPM PO 120 MG QAM 80 MG QPM Starting IN AM ON 7/25/06 ( 10 Instructions: Please do strict daily weights and call Dr. Petti with updates a few times a week HUMALOG INSULIN ( INSULIN LISPRO ) Sliding Scale ( subcutaneous ) SC AC Medium Scale Call HO if BS less than 60 If BS is less than 125 , then DO NOT Administer supplemental ( sliding scale ) insulin If BS is 125-150 , then give 0 units subcutaneously If BS is 151-200 , then give 1 units subcutaneously If BS is 201-250 , then give 3 units subcutaneously If BS is 251-300 , then give 5 units subcutaneously If BS is 301-350 , then give 7 units subcutaneously If BS is 351-400 , then give 8 units subcutaneously Call HO if BS is greater than 350 Please give at the same time and in addition to standing mealtime insulin HUMALOG MIX 75/25 ( INSULIN LISPRO MIX 75/25 ) 34 UNITS SC QAM HUMALOG MIX 75/25 ( INSULIN LISPRO MIX 75/25 ) 14 UNITS SC Q6PM COMBIVENT ( IPRATROPIUM AND ALBUTEROL SULFATE ) 2 PUFF INH QID IMDUR ER ( ISOSORBIDE MONONITRATE ( SR ) ) 60 MG PO DAILY Food/Drug Interaction Instruction Give on an empty stomach ( give 1hr before or 2hr after food ) LEVAQUIN ( LEVOFLOXACIN ) 500 MG PO DAILY Instructions: patient taking 10 day total course ( started at rehab facility on 10 of October ) Food/Drug Interaction Instruction Administer iron products a minimum of 2 hours before or after a levofloxacin or ciprofloxacin dose dose If on tube feeds , please cycle ( hold 1 hr before to 2 hr after ) Take 2 hours before or 2 hours after dairy products. Alert overridden: Override added on 6/2/06 by : POTENTIALLY SERIOUS INTERACTION: RISPERIDONE & LEVOFLOXACIN Reason for override: md aware , patient already taking it at rehab LEVOTHYROXINE SODIUM 175 MCG PO DAILY MILK OF MAGNESIA ( MAGNESIUM HYDROXIDE ) 30 MILLILITERS PO DAILY PRN Constipation NADOLOL 80 MG PO Q24H HOLD IF: SBP < 100 , HR < 55 Food/Drug Interaction Instruction Take consistently with meals or on empty stomach. PROTONIX ( PANTOPRAZOLE ) 40 MG PO DAILY RISPERDAL ( RISPERIDONE ) 0.25 MG PO BID TRAZODONE 25 MG PO Q6H PRN Anxiety MAXZIDE-25 ( TRIAMTERENE 37.5MG/HYDROCHLOROTHI... ) 1 TAB PO DAILY DIET: GROUND / 2 gm Na / ADA 2000 cals/day / Low saturated fat low cholesterol ACTIVITY: activity as tolerated , uses wheelchair FOLLOW UP APPOINTMENT( S ): Please call Dr. Kirby Deininger for appointment 1-2 weeks , ALLERGY: CAPTOPRIL ADMIT DIAGNOSIS: shortness of breath PRINCIPAL DISCHARGE DIAGNOSIS ;Responsible After Study for Causing Admission ) congestive heart failure OTHER DIAGNOSIS;Conditions , Infections , Complications , affecting Treatment/Stay h/o PNEUMONIA ( '93 , '95 ) #asthma# NIDDM CAD-MIx2 , 3v CABG'92 HYPOTHYROIDISM HYPERTENSION Hypercholesterolemia Urinary Incontinence LVH , LAE Tardive Dyskinesia Periumbilical Hernia R rotator cuff injury s/p quadriceps tear repair s/p ankle fx Elevated ESR Anemia drop foot copd ( chronic obstructive pulmonary disease ) cri ( chronic renal dysfunction ) RUE DVT ( in setting of PICC line ) OPERATIONS AND PROCEDURES: none OTHER TREATMENTS/PROCEDURES ( NOT IN O.R. ) diureses BRIEF RESUME OF HOSPITAL COURSE: cc: shortness of breath HPI: 78F with ischemic cardiomyopathy , CAD s/p CABG , possible COPD ( poor PFTs in 2004 ) , recent admit in 5/1 for incarcerated hernia s/p repair complicated by left frontal CVA w/ 100% carotid stenosis , NSTEMI , PICC-associated RUE DVT , enterococcus bacteremia , and gout flare. Had episodes of chest pain and shortness of breath from time to time. This AM , she complained of shortness of breath which has developed over the last few days. She denies chest pain , nausea , vomiting , diaphoresis. Staff at Cet E Hospital rehab facility noted tachypnea , dyspnea so EMS was called. O2 sat was 88%RA , BP 166/80 , HR 78 , RR 38. In the TH ED , she was 85% on 3L nc and was put on NRB. She was eventually put on CPAP and given lasix 120mg iv x1 , and nitro drip. O2 sat improved and was put back on nasal canula and NTG drip was discontinued. PMH: CAD s/p MI , CABGx3 1992 ( LIMA to LAD , SVG to OM , SVG to R PDA ) , PCI stent of SVG to OM in 2004 , NSTEMI 5/1 , IDDM , Left frontal CVA 5/1 with 100% left internal carotid stenosis , ischemic CMP EF 30% , HTN , hypothyroidism , s/p repair of incarcerated umbilical hernia 5/1 , s/p cholecystectomy , gout , CRI ( baseline 1.4-1.7 ) , COPD , RUE DVT 5/1 ( PICC associated , discharged with 2 week total course of lovenox but is still taking it ) , tardive dyskinesia , h/o back surgery ALL: ACEI -> cough , avoid all narcotics and sedatives SocHx: living at Rangebed Hospital Of rehab facility , diet: ground , diabetic , no added salt at S Lee'slukes Medical Center , 1 person transfer , self-feed Home meds: Lasix 80mg po bid. see D/C med list below ( was not taking Maxzide-25 at rehab ). also taking 10-day course of levaquin started on 4/30/06 at rehab for unclear reasons. Hospital course: 1 ) SOB: Patient stayed in the emergency room with resolution of symptoms. Admitted , but never went upstairs as she was discharged from the observation unit on 6/2/06 in the AM. She diuresed well to 120mg iv lasix x1. Evaluated by Dr. Steinhouse , her outpatient cardiologist. Likely gradual CHF exacerbation due to increased salt in diet and change in medications. She was not taking maxzide-25 and remained on lasix 80mg po bid lasix. She will now need to increase her lasix to 120mg po bix x2 days , then take 120mg po QAM + 80mg po QPM from now on. Strict daily weights and low salt <2gm diet. 2 ) RUE DVT: She was still receiving lovenox injections 100 daily , but apparently was supposed to complete a 2 week total course in February according to the medical records available. Dr. Lotthammer believed it was okay for her to stop as she has been on lovenox for approximately 4-5 weeks. 3 ) CODE: FULL. HCP: daughter Clair Mims 843-193-5920 , cell: 077-692-1935 4 ) DISPO: D/C to Morework Medical Center rehab facility. May need long-term nursing home care in the near future. Dr. Hai Wisch is following her closely. ADDITIONAL COMMENTS: 1 ) Please do strict daily weights. Call Dr. Renato Kushiner ( cardiologist ) for any reason including increases in weight. Also call him for updates a few times a week. 2 ) Low salt diet. Maximum 2 grams of sodium per day. 3 ) We restarted your Maxzide-25 daily. 4 ) Please take your lasix 120mg PO twice a day for 2 days total. You can then take lasix 120mg po every morning and 80mg po every night. 5 ) We stopped your lovenox injections because you have finished your 2 week course. DISCHARGE CONDITION: Stable TO DO/PLAN: 1 ) Please do strict daily weights. Call Dr. Raleigh Philmon ( cardiologist ) for any reason including increases in weight. Also call him for updates a few times a week. 2 ) Low salt diet. Maximum 2 grams of sodium per day. 3 ) We restarted your Maxzide-25 daily. 4 ) Please take your lasix 120mg PO twice a day for 2 days total. You can then take lasix 120mg po every morning and 80mg po every night. 5 ) We stopped your lovenox injections because you have finished your 2 week course. 6 ) Check electrolytes ( potassium and magnesium ). Keep potassium above 4.0 and magnesium at 2.0. No dictated summary ENTERED BY: BEDENBAUGH , SANTOS L , M.D. ( ZU35 ) 6/2/06 @ 01:54 PM ****** END OF DISCHARGE ORDERS ******
